column2: Text

The Daughters of Lahmia come to visit upon their Coven Throne. They drink the crimson from fine wine goblets and make veiled threats hidden behind fanged smiles. We must destroy them, but not yet… for now we play amenable hosts.
A plot of the Great Changer has come to fruition, the seeds of which were sown centuries ago. This will aid our cause.

As your raiders ply the chill seas in search of fresh lands to plunder, all at once the cold grows greater still. In an instant, the sea all around transforms to unforgiving ice! Yet even so, your men's ship remains whole and undamaged, its path clear. This must be a sign from the Gods! They give you their dark blessing in your endevours, keeping the seaways clear for you to plunder new lands.
Mysterious Stranger

The Shrine of Khaine is yours now. Within sleeps Widowmaker, Aenarion's bane and the God of Murder's own blade. Consecrate the area by building the Altar of Khaine and the power will be yours to wield!
The Eye of the Gods

A conclave of your generals has struck upon the notion of pressing popular musicians into military service. This has come as a shock to the performers in question, but has proved an instant hit with the troops and they’re marching harder than ever before. Army movement range has increased!
Hexensnacht
Food is scarce. The fetid hand of Nurgle is no doubt involved, causing crops to wither, milk to sour and game to diminish. Another source of sustenance must be found.
Nurgle's Rot
Useless Contraptions
Clan Trouble

While the slavers of the Point are some of the meanest and cruellest men upon Lustria's coast, even they pale to the  mighty Norse Chieftains. The merchants grovel at your feet, desperate to appease you and your retinue out of a pathetic fear of what will happen if they earn your displeasure. Gold is given as tribute.

column1: At first they draw a blank on a willing guide - they are coast-huggers who rarely venture into the jungle interior. Then, one of the slave-masters dares make a suggestion. He leads you to a cage, in which a small reptile with a blue crest hisses defiantly. The locals call it a Skink and claim that with the right amount of 'persuasion' it will lead you to your quarry.
column2: true

The Dark Elf merchant is suspiciously pleased to receive the Norse, venturing that he will be a willing buyer should they retrieve the corpse of the 'Mother of the Flame'. He points to the extinguished pinion that is sat upon a dais guarded by two Druchii warriors. He cautions that this will be no easy hunt. Legend has it, the Phoenix is a creature of Hekarti, existing between the mortal plane and in the Realm of Chaos. It only makes its appearance on the side of the mortal veil rarely, once a century at most. It is 'awoken' into this world through the heart of a burning volcano.

column1: According to the Dark Elf, that is the time to strike. They are vulnerable during those early moments of awakening, but will quickly gain strength and become deadly and all but impervious to attack.
column2: true
By their very nature, Skaven love to talk, so you manage to keep them busy until your scouts return. As they ride into the clearing the Skaven are surprised and panic, turn their tails and run away!
Ratmen are neither rats nor men; you easily slay the Skaven. Their bodies are still littering your camp when the scouting party returns.
Confused, impressed or afraid... you're not sure which; Skaven features are so hard to read. Either way, your ruse works: the Skaven eventually offer you tribute before quickly departing.
Sometimes there's no way out but to reach for your purse. You begrudgingly pay the creatures and leave with your life intact, if not your dignity.

Skaven are not the best conversationalists and you soon run out of things to say. You stall for as long as you can, but the scouting party never returns. Your only option is to pay the Skaven if you wish to live.
You fight bravely but are soon overpowered by the Skaven's overwhelming numbers. They take care to ensure you are unable to follow them before disappearing.
The more you talk, the less the Skaven seem to buy your story. Eventually they tire of listening and attack you. In the ensuing struggle, you escape with your life, but barely.
Piracy

The green Warp-glow of Morrslieb, the evil moon, waxes sick and bright above this army. The Clanrats are invigorated by its iridescent energies, recovering from their wounds and replacing their numbers more swiftly than usual. Army replenishment rate has increased due to the great, weird moon's baleful influence.

While Necromancy and Death Magic are essential to the raising of the dead, there are other forms of magic such as Life and Light that are anathema to such rituals. When Jade and Light Wizards wander, the Undead suffer.

Burrowing and delving deep beneath the Vaults, your miner-prospectors have unearthed a vast Warpstone geode, untouched since the Great Catastrophe! This motherlode is the richest source seen in many years, and Warp-technology unit recruitment costs have fallen factionwide as a result of this enormous boon.
Exodus
Not very Noble
There is no obvious way of getting into the vault safely, let alone retrieving the armour and getting out again. Your retainers will just have to survive without it.
The armour is far too large and cumbersome to carry out of the flooded chamber without specialised equipment. However, whilst inspecting it, your men find a most interesting item.
The armour is indeed the work of a master armourer, and it's surprisingly light too. Your retainers have no problems recovering it from the flooded vault.
Using a series of controlled demolition charges you are able to create a new chamber to drain the water away. The plan works flawlessly and you recover the high quality armour fully intact.
An Intrigue Backfires
Your men quickly discover that the armour is far too heavy to retrieve from the water. After a thorough search of the vault you leave empty-handed.

One of your retainers assures you that he has the perfect magical item for this job. The Mage enters the vault alone and soon after there is a huge explosion, burying him and the magical item deep beneath the ground.
In an attempt to drain the chamber you accidentally trigger a cave-in; the chamber is now blocked by fallen rocks and debris. Whatever was in there is likely to remain buried, forever.
A Stab In the Dark
A Chill Wind
Blood Favours

Their sad lament over lifetimes spent and lost has driven our Undead Lords into a furious frenzy! In an effort to quell the feelings of anger and loss, many of their servants are set to work performing tasks that only the living need undertake.
Geheimnisnacht
Rouse the Veterans!
Cutting the foul, sickening flesh causes great gouts of pus and slime to gush forth, tainting the earth with its repellent corruption. Stand well back!
Whilst lifting the flaps of pallid flesh one of your retainers accidentally cuts the Daemon, causing great gouts of pus and slime to gush forth, tainting the ground with foul corruption.
Leaving well alone be may be the most sensible course of action here. It is impossible to truly kill a Daemon of Nurgle, you would only invoke its ire.
The Daemon tells the truth! Your warriors are all replenished by the healing properties of the tears. But of course, you always knew this boon would come at a terrible cost...
Obviously, Daemons of Chaos are not be trusted! Slaying the creature wipes the nauseating taint of its putrefaction from the ruins.
The Daemon was trying to distract you - a sleight of repulsive, pustulating hand, no less! Hidden beneath its foetid flesh you find chests stuffed with treasure.
Invigorating Aqshy
Boiling Point
Press-Ganged
Favourable Winds
Paychest Mercenaries
Wax-Sealed Rations
Trunk of Maps
Count Noctilus
Moment of Lucidity
The queen returns to defend Ulthuan. Her presence bolsters your soldiers - no amount of Druchii armour could defend against them!

A High Sister of Avelorn has compiled much practical wisdom and advanced missile techniques, such as trajectory calculus, into a manual of sorts. This splendid new tome has been circulated to your armies in order to enhance their training regimes; the experience of missile unit recruits has risen as a result.
War has broken out between rival tribes of the horde. An example must be made to ensure the Marauders will only fight what our Master's desire.
The Dragon Ogres Awake

A cult of Taal within Talabheim has grown in power and fermented resentment over Sigmar's ascendancy, supposedly at Taal's expense. A religious war within the borders of the Empire is now almost a certainty.
Bark & Soul
It's Raining Magma
A Tale of Treachery
Armour of Glimril Scales
Armour of Glimril Scales
The weather in these lands is rarely governed by the seasons, and now a blizzard of icy shards has come scything down from the mountains. Those not prepared will die.

Arcane Fulcrums are terrible, complex and eldritch monoliths whose nature and function have puzzled the finest minds for millennia. Should a magic-user stand at the pinnacle of the one found here then his powers will be greatly enhanced.
Fire
The insidious taint of Chaos is not just found in the north. The Great Changer has many agents and followers working nefarious schemes within the Empire's vast society.

Uttering the dark litanies contained with the third Book of Nagash has caused a furious, swirling sandstorm to come into existence. Now it threatens to consume all in its path – even the Liche Priests’ death magic cannot hold back the savagery of the elements this time!

In Har Ganeth, the Dark Elf desire for murder and blood is kept in abeyance by the strictest of laws in Naggaroth. Only on Death Night are these laws put on hold and the Druchii permitted to unleash their true instincts. Bloody excess and wanton slaughter flood the boulevards and plazas, all under Hellebron’s intense gaze - tonight is Death Night!

column1: Hellebron will meet the dawn revitalised and strong from the night’s bloody orgy, although over time she will wither once more. In the Death Night’s aftermath her followers are sated, their murderous impulses gratified for now.
column2: true
Infamy Rank Increased
Lost
Something in the Deeps
A building's structure has become unsound, and those within have been evacuated. In order to restore its function, it must be repaired soon.

Crone Hellebron has ordered Death Night be extended by two further nights this year. The streets of Har Ganeth are awash with blood and viscera as its inhabitants release their pent-up, year-long furies in a breathtaking orgy of bloodletting. As a result, Witch Elf recruitment costs have fallen, and their starting experience level has increased.

Knowing that other, more unsavoury individuals may also be drawn to the monster’s valuable carcass, you delayed sending in your own small salvage party. When you eventually sent them a few days later they found that the majority of the loot had already been extracted from the beast’s belly, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort.

Knowing that other, more unsavoury individuals may also be drawn to the Marienburg wreckage, you delayed sending in your own small salvage party. When you eventually sent them a few days later they found that the majority of the loot had already been extracted from the wreckage, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort.

You are no fool – you'd heard such songs before – they were clearly the work of Syreens, the hated Banshees of the sea. You later sent in a smaller expedition to extract whatever wealth could be found, but only a few of them returned after being attacked by a large mob of Zombie pirates. Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered by those who survived and made it back.

Knowing that other, more unsavoury individuals may also be drawn to the monster’s valuable carcass, you delayed sending in your own small salvage party. When you eventually sent them a few days later they found that the majority of the loot had already been extracted from the beast’s belly, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort.

Having given the order to briefly drop anchor, it is not long before you observed an Empire ship opportunistically approaching the partially-submerged pirate galleon. The Empire troops started to unload items back onto their ship, but before you could order an interception, they were suddenly engulfed by a large, sulphurous explosion. The pirate shipwreck, now in a million pieces, was booby-trapped! You gathered what paltry bits of loot you could find floating nearby and hastily left the area.

Deciding to first find out more about the island, you ordered your ship to drop anchor. When you eventually sent a small salvage party into the island a few days later, they were quickly attacked and almost wiped out by a large mob of Zombie pirates. Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered from the island by the few who made it back, but before you could send a larger salvage crew back in, the mysterious island disappeared completely.

You waited for the rival salvagers to leave, after which you sent your crew in to take a closer look at the sea beast’s remains. The majority of the loot had already been taken, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort. These pirates may be greedy and opportunistic, but they weren’t very thorough!

Having decided to wait to discover the fate of the convoy’s wreckage, you eventually receive word that several deadly sea battles took place at the site. Allegedly, very few ships managed to get in and out of the area with anything of any value without being set upon by murderous rivals. In the ensuing chaos, most of the loot ended up at the bottom of the ocean, but your scouts in the area still managed to recover a few valuables from the site.

Knowing that other, more unsavoury individuals may also be drawn to the ‘cursed’ island, you delayed sending in your own small salvage party. When you eventually sent them a few days later they found that the majority of the loot had already been extracted from the wreckage, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort.

Deciding to wait for the pirates to leave the area, you dropped anchor a safe distance from the cove behind some neighbouring islets. After the black ship departed, you led your troops into the cold, damp enclosure, where you managed to find a few sacks of loot, but most of it had been taken away in the black ship. No risk, little reward!
Foetid Daughter of Grandfather Nurgle
Foetid Daughter of Grandfather Nurgle
Foetid Daughter of Grandfather Nurgle
Foetid Daughter of Grandfather Nurgle
Foetid Daughter of Grandfather Nurgle
Foetid Daughter of Grandfather Nurgle

The Blood Voyage has met its end. As expected, it is only in death that these blood-crazed murderers ceased their quest for murder. With their last breaths, their victims must have lamented their very existence, but to you their madness is nothing but a benefit - the loot they accumulated from battle now passes on to you.
The sound of the bickering voices in Luthor’s head have been momentarily silenced, allowing him to regain some of his old powers – at least for now.
Having seen you cherry-pick the best pieces for yourself, your warriors are less than impressed with the leftovers; the brittle blades break on impact and the shields splinter when touched.
Possibly, you've misjudged your allies - they scoff at the poorly made weapons and begin to question your integrity. Sometimes, a good deed is its own punishment.
Weapons? We can forge finer blades ourselves. It would appear that they are the only treasure to be found here - a thorough search of the city reveals nothing of any real value.
This is not much of a find, all in all - your troops have no need of these second-rate weapons, that may crumble when used in anger.
There's some really fine pieces here! After taking a few that take your fancy, your warriors take their pick of the remainder. Pleased, they pledge to fight with renewed fervour.
Thinking laterally, you realise that, although your own troops are well supplied, your allies who would find these weapons useful in their struggles against the foe.
Weapons? We can forge finer blades ourselves. Beyond the barracks lies an untouched temple, offerings to the gods still littered about it. This is the reason why we came here.
Declare Heresy
Chimera Frenzy
The kvinn (Khazalid for lady) population of the Hold have denounced the quality of male stock from which to choose a husband. As a result, the majority of maidens have left in search of fresh beards.

Your raiders take what they want from those they attack, but recent pillage has included little that can serve as food. At the same time, game is sparse in the north; you send out hunting parties but they return with nothing to show for their efforts. Your men are tough but when a warrior's belly is empty, his strength ebbs.
The Withering of Taal

Count Hertwig of Ostermark has declared his province free of the 'Emperor's Yoke'. Ostermark is now an independent nation, the Elector Count has announced. Apparently, envoys are already in the courts of Bretonnia and Marienburg. Do not rule out the politicking of the Burgomeisters in this. If so, they must be punished!
As expected, it is a fortifying drink indeed and now Grombrindal is ready to fight! Bugman sends the White Dwarf on his way with one of his best scouts.
Grombrindal is ready to fight! Bugman sends the White Dwarf on his way with one of his best scouts.
A building's foundations have disintegrated, with whole sections collapsing on top of the hapless Skaven working below. It must be repaired before it can perform its function again.
Heroic Spawning!

A battle-scarred Saurus Oldblood has come to your attention at the urging of the Mage-Priests. More feral than his brethren, he has a natural empathy with the great beasts of Lustria, who rally to him as one of their own. With much fasting and meditation, others are learning to commune in this fashion. As a result, recruitment costs for monstrous creatures have fallen factionwide.
So what if their homes have been destroyed? At least they still have their lives! You decide their plight isn't your problem and walk away.
You free the survivors from the rubble. Grateful for your kindness, they swear a vow to serve you until their dying days. You suppose there may one day be a need for them.
The survivors say they will lead you to a cache of supplies in return for saving their lives. After you free them, they make good on their promise.
Ignoring the cries for help you continue your search and find a small cache of gemstones in a collapsed building nearby. Truly, a serendipitous event!
Your retainers get to work, moving much of the rubble, but by the time you get to the bodies it is already too late.
Amazed by your callousness, the survivors let out a string of curses as you walk away. They will all die, but it is too late to reverse the effects of their magical mischief.
Ignoring the cries for help you continue your search, but there is nothing of value. Time to leave...
Da Bad Moon
Beardless Wonder
The Disappeared
War-Weary

A ribald rhymer of raucous repute has arrived in your lands. As you tour the settlements his vulgar verse spreads like the Galloping Scumpox, sowing boundless cheer in the locals; public order has now risen in response.
Death Night
Peasant Revolt
The Gods look upon the warherds and are angry… Such is the fickle power of Chaos.
Infamy Rank Increased
Bring Forth the Dead!
Chaos Cult Discovered

The world yields to those who master the Winds of Magic. Great bolts from the heavens scour souls from bodies, whilst raging torrents of fire rend the very flesh from bone. Magic can rip enemies into a dozen pieces or leave nothing but an ugly bloodstain where once they stood. The power granted by the cataclysm, many eons ago, can be harnessed now to bring ruin and destruction upon our enemies. All those who feel the pull of Magic feel it grow as the world festers under Chaos’ Ruinous gaze; their need to ravage grows stronger and stronger by the hour.

You have made a mistake... the stranger is a skilful fighter who wounds you before slipping away into the night. The lesson? That you're not alone in the ruins - others seek the treasure and are prepared to kill for it.
Cautiously, you extend your hand in greeting. Fearfully, they back away; clearly, misfortune has driven the poor wretch mad - their incoherent babbling reveals nothing of value.
After hours of fruitless following, the stranger finally disappears in a dead end. Realising that they must have had magical help to evade you, your patience wears thin and you give up the chase.
Following mysterious strangers into alleys is folly, especially when the Winds of Magic are abroad. Best to ignore the figure and back carefully down the street, with weapons drawn.
The figure draws a sword! Although points could be awarded for suicidal bravery, the stranger clearly has no chance and is easily slain. Close inspection reveals a talisman of great power!
You approach the hooded figure and offer a cautious greeting. It soon becomes clear that they mean no harm and could prove useful. After a short conversation they agree to join your party.
The stranger leads you around for hours without purpose or direction. Stopping for a moment, you stumble over a number of well-stocked chests. The hooded figure disappears as you rifle through them.

A recent clutch of reports regarding ill-discipline in the lower ranks is cause for concern. Clearly, clods are being hired - this has to stop! Recruitment costs have risen accordingly, but new recruits begin two ranks higher.
The Boon of Tzeentch
Overflowing with Power

A previously hostile Elector Count is ready to sue for peace. The Electors are political animals, so it is doubtful this gesture is motivated by selfless reasons, more likely another agenda is at play.
Lahmian Visit

A savage storm strikes in the night. Its violent winds, laced with shards of ice that slice though the hardest metal, have scythed through your forces. Your warriors awaken to discover that some of the strongest have failed to withstand the wrath of the Gods, and been shredded by the storm's unearthly might.

The Dreaming Woods, Athel Caiellin, is a forbidden place ruled by the worshippers of Slaanesh. To travel there is to flirt with madness and temptation, and those that emerge are either wracked by lunacy, or forged by the crucible of their experiences. This one has walked through the fires of insanity, and found an ethereal strength on the other side...
Lacking further leads, the Supreme Patriarch Balthasar Gelt offers a bounty for any information which might lead to an explanation.
Tide of Flagellants
Gifted Musicians

With Belegar's forces in control of the area, an extensive search is carried out. Urk trails are quickly found that lead to previously hidden entrances to the Underway. Such portals are new, and far beyond the skills of the Greenskins to create, but are undoubtedly in use by their sworn enemies. Belegar doesn't like this deduction at all - it suggests coercion or, at the worst, even treason. Either fate is a great sin in the eyes of the Ancestors.
Plague Outbreak!
Spider Boom

Amongst the plunder snatched from the soft southern lands, your men have brought back useless and distracting trinkets with no obvious function. Rather than discarding such wastes of time and effort in favour of further bloodying their blades to honour the Gods, some of your warriors are taking an interest in these foolish contraptions.
Da Bosses Are Not 'Appy
Virtuous Noble
A Bone To Pick
Volatile Vortex
Morrslieb's Blessing
Your followers praise their leader and pray to the gods for their continuing support. They hold a great feast in your honour.
Bad Things in Stirland
Your buildings have taken critical damage and cannot perform their function. Deploy the repair crews!
Torturers Deployed
Infamy Rank Increased
The Forge of Starlight

Flooded Armoury
Shyish blows so strongly in this area that our army 'as been reinforced with the deepest essence o'magic. For the time being at least, it'll be far easier to control.

Scurrilous rumours regarding this army's quartermasters abound. They issue the worst weapons and armour, keeping the best for themselves; they skim the rations and worse yet whisper mockeries of the Great Horned Rat! The rank-and-file are restive, and it's becoming increasingly expensive to bribe newcomers into joining - army leadership is down, and recruitment costs have risen.
Arcane Spawning!
Sky Saboteur!
During your dalliances on the high seas you came across stranded crew, willing to join you in exchange for food and rescue.
The Winds of Pain

Epilogue
Rewards of Ruin
The enemy has unearthed and purged one of our cults. We will recover, but the coven lost some potential influencers that should have served our cause for years to come.
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!

From deep within the tunnel comes a deafening howl, followed by a savage, many-tentacled beast that attacks without warning. In the ensuing fight, several of your party are badly wounded but all manage to escape.

You wait for hours, but the scouts never return; it's looking like some foul luck indeed has befallen your retainers. The rest of your party are clearly spooked, so you leave without a backward glance.
Your retainers are a tad overzealous collapsing the tunnel, and some of your supplies are caught in the blast. Angered, you leave the idiots to their fate and leave the building.
Pushing a retainer down the tunnel ahead of you doesn't look good in front of the others, however practical. You decide not to investigate the tunnel and leave, with haste.
From deep within the tunnel comes a rumbling growl, followed by a strange beast that attacks without warning; battle ensues. Fortunately, you are able to slay the beast and escape unscathed.

You ask for volunteers and soon a scouting party is deployed. They discover a hidden treasure deep within the tunnel. Although it takes awhile for them to retrieve it, the hoard proves to be well worth the wait.
Nothing good can come from exploring these tunnels, except maybe a slow, painful death as the lunch of something deeply unpleasant. You collapse the tunnel entrance and walk away.
The Black Hunger
The still-living smallfolk of our realms have gathered with torches and pitchforks daring to approach our castles with their petty demands! Such an insurgence must not be tolerated!
Missing Tome
Glowing Idol
A large gathering of Flagellants combined with the usual rabble-rousers and malcontents have inflamed a riot. This will need halting or it may spread to other settlements.
The Centigors raid a nearby brewery, bringing back barrels of mannish beer. The herd gathers to slake their thirst.
Over-gyrating Shaman
Tomb of the Mummy
Tomb of the Mummy

Some enterprising scribe has mass-produced and issued thousands of parchment images of a blushing, beardless Dwarf in his birthday-suit! You can't turn a corner in the Undercity without seeing a pack of Clanrats punching each other and snickering uncontrollably at a poster of 'Nudey No-Beard'! Funnily enough, leadership versus Dwarfs has risen factionwide.
The Gods look upon the hordes and are angry… such is the fickle power of Chaos.
Punisher of the Weak
In Caledor's Name

This night, no darkness comes to the vastness of the North. Instead the sun shines bright, remaining high in the sky above. It can only be a sign from the Gods, telling you to urge your men on to greater savagery and plunder. None shall rest until darkness returns!
Eternal Night

A brutish Gor - a pretender and nothing more - challenges the chieftain of the brayherd. The young-horn will pay for such folly - their horns adorning banners, and their hearts offered to the Dark Gods.
During your dalliances on the high seas you came across stranded crew, willing to join you in exchange for food and rescue.

A Goblin eagerly accepts the bribe and details where the false prophet is currently hidden. Wurrzag listens and then hands over the reward. The gobbo’s eyes light up at seeing all the booty. Such elation is short-lived though, as Wurrzag loudly proclaims to his followers that any who knew this information but withheld it for gain are clearly enemies of Mork and Gork… That night Wurrzag’s most fervent followers eat roasted, bribed gobbo...
Dwarf Maidens Emigrate

A pride of monstrous Chimerae has flown down from the mountain reaches - or displaced by some other foul threat - and are causing havoc amongst the populace. It will be some time before they can be removed!
The seeds of Heresy is suspected in one of our settlements. The Grand Theogonist has released a Witch Hunter and charged him to root out the Chaos taint!
Chaotic Fungus

This world breeds tough men; some of whom can also be bitter, cruel and greedy. They mob together in gangs of brigands to prey upon travellers and traders.
Clan Honour
Favoured of the Cult
Strength from Shyish
The Granter of Savage Hate demands more slaughter! The Blood God imbues the warherd with a proportion of his rage.
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!

The Hold's brewery has run dry. For the Dawi, this is a disaster! The Brewmaster has already withdrawn in shame, and the Dwarfs have been forced to import weak, mannish brews in the interim. Morale is at an all-time low.
Unnatural Vigour
The Wild Heath

Wanaz - Clanless Dwarfs - have come to the Hold hoping for sanctuary despite the shame such charity will bring upon their ancestors. A small lessening of our honour by accepting them is made up for with a boost to population numbers.

It has long been rumoured that Stirland's proximity to Sylvania means its courts are susceptible to Vampire infiltration. Our spies suspect such an occurrence, for Stirland is being aggressive to us. The influence of the von Carsteins is surely to blame.

Whilst travelling through Lustria's jungles, one of our regiments has been attacked by a band of warrior-women who moved silently through the trees before disappearing again as swiftly as they appeared. We should proceed with caution.
Festag

Many hours' worth of toil, and many coffers' worth of coin have been poured into the restoration of the Grail Monastery. Now, returned to its former glory, nobles have rushed to send their children there to learn from Bretonnia's most prestigious academics.

The military complex of the Empire is a strange beast with no centralised standing army. The Grafs and Electors control their own men but even so, their Captains may favour one leader over another as in the case of this Captain publicly supporting you.
Your Lord's extensive seafaring expertise has been brought to bear, bringing in lots of extra loot during recent encounters.
Brutish Overseer

A bitter blood-feud between two lieutenants in this army - one feared and respected, the other universally loathed - has been swiftly dealt with. Perhaps too swiftly, for in his rage the wrong Elf was slain. As a result, the army's leadership has fallen and recruitment costs have risen too.
The Hochland Long War

Rebellion is in the air, one of your Bosses has been heard slagging you off over his grog! A few are getting their heads together and muttering. You'll need to assert your dominance sooner rather than later.
Stab-stab for Master!
Amulet of Sea Gold
The Grateful Earth

The most recent tourney was heralded as a great success; violence, bloodshed and feasting galore! It has been many days, yet people are still abuzz at the grandeur of it all. Truly, Bretonnia is blessed.
Cache of Asaph
Blessings of the Maggoth Lords
Magic is Chaos
A Map of Karak Zorn
The Dreamer of Dreams
Blades of Ice
A Personality Takes Over!

Phakth is pleased with his tribute. As the knife strikes home and the Norscan exhales his last, a glow suffuses Settra's troop, and a bright beam pierces the firmament, highlighting a point of land far-distant. A Liche Priest produces a map and marks the destination.

The Liche Priests bend to their work. As the Norscan is swiftly denuded, he babbles the source of his wealth: Ice Tooth Mountain. His outsize skeleton is soon back on its feet, an impressive specimen indeed. Settra commands it to lead the way to his crown's resting-place.
Elector Sues For Peace
The smallfolk have barricaded themselves in their homes, for this is the dread night of mysteries - when both moons are seen in the night sky and the dead awake to drag the living to hell…
A Bray-Shaman is cast aside while trying to dominate a Cygor. The cloven mage will recover but is wounded for now.
Memories of the Past

To the many bitter trials you must endure is added a new and unexpected one: the sky itself rains blood on your army! But while lesser men might curse or cower your ferocious warriors see this for the sign from the Gods that it is. They welcome the bloody rain, just as they welcome the chance to bathe in the blood of your enemies.
The Liche Lord
The Liche Lord

One of this army's lieutenants has attempted to curry favour with his captain using the largesse of his family's estate. The offer turned sour when the captain, looking more deeply into his subordinate's background, discovered his house to be a distant ally of Morathi. Publicly denouncing the Lieutenant - who has since left the service - should have worked, but the army's reputation has been harmed beyond immediate repair. Army leadership has fallen, and recruitment costs have risen as a result of this shame.
Even stone may weaken and crumble with the passage of time. A building within this region has deteriorated unexpectedly and must be repaired - get to it with haste!
Portents of doom cloud this settlement and so many of its inhabitants flee to seek sanctuary - or a change in fortunes - elsewhere.

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him the use of a spell for a short time. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...
Jungle Warriors

As our power grows, it gains the attention of other foreboding creatures, the wailing hags emerge from their swamp and foetid haunts to join us in the destruction of the living - a Tomb Banshee has come.
Eye of the Gods

The ferocious foreman of your logging operation has been applying the whip with unseemly zeal. Workers are vacating the camps en masse and timber production is dwindling, driving up the construction costs.
The pirate fleets of Sartosa travel far and wide looking for bounty. Now they come across your trade routes and are attacking our ships.
The Granter of Savage Hate sees our warherd for a brief moment, blessing the Gors with an exceptionally ruthless gift.
Splendid Monastery
Wax & Wane

A bitter disagreement has come about between Ostland and Hochland over who invented the famous long rifle! Ages-old resentments have come to the surface, and, due to our alliance with Hochland, Ostland view us in an extremely hostile light.
The Quick & The Dead
With a "Bamf!"
The lands are haunted - spirits and ghosts of dead warriors, victims of battles long-since fought - harass and frighten our warriors. This is a bad omen.
Famine
Disturbing the Dead
Disturbing the Dead
Disturbing the Dead
Disturbing the Dead
Disturbing the Dead
Disturbing the Dead
Disturbing the Dead
Exalted
Grandiose Tournament
The Forgotten Speech
Flay the flesh from his bones and press him into eternal service.
Sacrifice the barbarian to Phakth, the God of Justice, and request a boon.
Avenge the Gods
Gromril Seam
Beasts of the Deep
Lost Convoy
The Cursed Islet
Hidden Pirate Cove
Leviathan Surfaces
Sunken Booty
The Risen Isle
Monsters of the Sea
Treasure Down Below
Island Song
A Skink Priest of great skill has arisen from the sacred spawning pools and is now available for service!
Misinterpretation!
The Miners would dig to the core of the world if they could, but this time they may have tunnelled too far, bore too deep into the roots of the mountain, for something stirs, something dreadful…

A close ally of yours has been shamed - a record has been unearthed concerning his ancestor reneging on an oath. The sins of past generations must be answered by the living, and so he has given up his wealth and status to take the Slayer Oath.
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!

It was done. The Merwyrm was slain by the empowered Star-metal Harpoon; a testament to the monster-killing lineage of the Wulfharts. Now the beast was resurrected and in thrall to Harkon, the Vampire Coast would expand and Luthor would be a force in the wider world once more.

column1: This was no mere idle boast, for his mind had finally begun to align - the choir in his head would still bicker and rage on occasion, but were held in awe to a new voice, one that spoke with the wisdom of eons, as if it was older than Harkon even. It promised to guide Luthor and bring about an Undead empires to dwarf the current pretenders, especially the petty vassal-fiefdom of the von Carsteins. And when all that was achieved, the voice swore Harkon would be worthy of the greatest prize - to be at the right hand of a new Death-God… to be a Mortarch.
Luthor Harkon will not be on the periphery when the End Times come!
column2: true

A charismatic soothsayer has impassioned the locals in this province with his doctrine of vigorous procreation. While the population is sharply rising, an exhausted workforce is a not a productive one.
A deadly spell has been unleashed onto the world, sending the Chaos Sorcerer and any in his immediate vicinity back into the Realm of Chaos.
Recruiting Shortage
Drakk Attack!
Worker of the Runes
Everyday more of your followers flock to the city in fear that some terrible peril or enemy horde will murder them without the protection of its walls.
Evanescent Rift
Wraith & Home
Arcane Fulcrum
The Colleges of Magic rarely agree, but on this occasion they are aligned and will support you. A Battle Wizard is sent to accompany your forces.
The Fall of Men
Midnight Sun
Morrslieb glows and refuses to leave the sky, even when day should have been summoned. The continuing darkness lends power to our legions as they march ever on!

When a slave steps on your foot, how should you respond? With incandescent rage perhaps, consuming them and several others in a coruscating conflagration? This young Dark One did just that, to your resounding approval, and is now available for use.

A powerful Mage - one schooled in the ancient ways first developed by the mighty Caledor Dragontamer - has pledged his allegiance to you. Elves of such distinction, who have immersed themselves completely in the study of High Magic, should be retained and deployed in your service, to the detriment of his enemies!
Phar Away Gold
Ogres from the eastern kingdoms have come on the pretence of looking for work, but instead are causing quite a lot of bother, damage, and have eaten a few of the Watch as well…

It is whispered that elements of this army once visited Quetza, the defiled city, and were irrevocably changed by what they saw. Such rumours have reached fever-pitch of late and the Slann would do well to quash them! This army now suffers low leadership and increased recruitment costs.

The spirits that refuse to leave the mortal plane remain in the forest, fusing with living trees to become Treemen. These warriors are mighty and terrifying, yet each one that leaves the forest to fight weakens it, if only temporarily.
You order your experts glean whatever they can from it. However, their time is wasted - nothing worthwhile is discovered and your citizens are disgusted that you brought such evil into their midst.
As no ambush presents itself, you take the machinery to rival Skaven who are known to pay for any advantage over their nemeses. However, they refuse, as it was abandoned for good reason...
You have the machines melted down for your own purposes. However, the metals are laced with disease that quickly kills your artisans and spreads through your population.
Would the Skaven really leave evidence of their researches just lying around? You think not; obviously, this is an ambush, so you leave without further ado.
Your experts are impressed by the Skaven's grasp of technology. This is ground-breaking stuff, revealing new manufacturing methods that could be used to your advantage.
Time spent searching the area reveals no ratmen lying in wait to surprise you. You collect the discarded machinery and find a rival Skaven clan eager to make a deal.
Whatever these Skaven intended, their feeble science is of little interest. The reclaimed materials are put to good use by your own artisans. There are no obvious ill effects... for now.

Word has reached us that Vlad von Carstein - the first of the Midnight Aristocracy - and long-since thought slain at the Siege of Altdorf, is abroad. For now these sightings are nothing more than rumours, but should they be true then our plans could be undone, as his ambition overcomes all!
A Dark Winnowing
The Queen of Ulthuan
The cruel sun bakes the lands - Stromfels, God of Storms, punishes us. The people grow restless as water and food diminish.
Nyklaus von Carstein has approached us, requesting resources to go on some bizarre quest into a lost sea realm he calls the "Galleon's Graveyard". He will no doubt be resentful if we refuse.

A building in one of your settlements has suffered catastrophic damage! Irksomely, but fairly inconsequentially, it has also collapsed on a great congregation of slaves. Naturally, it must be repaired before it can function again, and the slave population in this province has declined.
Mannslieb's orbit strains and the lands flood, causing watery devastation in its wake…

There is talk of entire armies who fight without a cause of their own, instead offering their services in return for payment in gold! Such soldiers cannot be trusted - we must ensure they are not used against us!

In a expression of deep and abiding respect for their winged mounts, a detachment of Phoenix Guard has journeyed to the Shrine of Asuryan, and performed a ritual to Aqshy, the Wind of Fire. Thus invigorated, Aqshy blows hard and fierce, in turn suffusing the Flamespyre Phoenixes with a newfound vitality. Even the Frostheart Phoenixes are impressed with this gift to their younger brethren. As a result, Phoenix recruitment costs have fallen factionwide.
Death Night fades from the memories of those that serve you. Take these slaves as a gift; call another Death Night, so all may bathe in its destructive glory.
Araby Sandstone
Strigoi Ghoul Swarm
Death Night
An arcane tempest scours the land, causing untold damage as well as emboldening unsanctioned sorcerers and rousing monstrous beasts from their lairs.
The shrine goes up in flames, but as the dust settles a ghostly figure rises from the ashes. This is not the result you had in mind...
The shrine is powerful and the cleansing ritual is time-consuming and costly. However, once it is complete you are able to remove all the artefacts found within.

There is nothing of value within the shrine. During the course of the search you begin to feel different; the room starts to swim and your temperature soars! Clearly, you are now in the grip of a dark and terrible curse!
Upon the altar are pages that appear to be from one of the Great Necromancer's Nine Books! The place is clearly cursed! Get out while you still can!
The shrine goes up in flames, taking the rest of the building with it. Better safe than sorry - you torch the surrounding area also before moving on.
Following a complicated ritual you are able to cleanse the shrine and remove the taint of the Undead from the room. You no longer have the feeling that you are under observation.
Embedded in the centre of the shrine you find a powerful magical item. You are surprised when you are able to easily lift it free.
The Hochland Long War

The Centigors raid a nearby winery, bringing back barrels of suspicious liquid. The herd gathers and drinks... only to suffer a hellish hangover! No wonder it is only foppish man-filth and the stinking elf-kin that drink such rot!
Even the most cunning of Necromancers or powerful Vampires need cadavers to bring the Undead forth. Supplies have run low here; until fresh corpses can be found, troops will be hard to come by.
Undead Sentinels
Undead Sentinels
Undead Sentinels
Undead Sentinels
Undead Sentinels
Undead Sentinels
Undead Sentinels
Chalice of Potions
Trade Problems

New targeting techniques have been introduced to your armies' training regimens, teaching the troops to focus on the enemy's weak points. Damage from missile weapons has increased factionwide as a result.
Angry Letter
The Baroness
Beware the Twin-Tailed Comet
Grateful Paragons

Now that the Books of Nagash are in your grasp, the Great Necromancer’s immense source of power is yours to wield. On the battlefield, your enemies will wither and die before your unstoppable legions. To battle – to conquest, in life, death, Unlife and beyond!
This army has undertaken a rigorous new training regime focused on frontline combat, yielding excellent results. All units now have improved melee attack capabilities.
Blood Dragons
Gobbo Riots
Schadenfreude
The herds of Chaos are active. The Beastmen emerge from the forests and raid your more-isolated settlements, bringing ruin and taking captives.
Let the Games Begin
Our agents 'ave managed to acquire plans an' schematics detailin' all sorts of interesting new advancements our enemies are developin', 'indering their research efforts but greatly aiding our own.
Hoard Uncovered!
The Spawn Tide
Ensorcelled Blades
Heavy Iron
The Bloody Red Spot
Mathlann’s Blessing
Curse of Cannibalism
The Axe of Grimnir
Ghal Maraz
Blood Sacrifice
Ambitious Necromancer
Undead Pirates
Death Night
The only pacts you make are with the Dark Gods themselves. Flay this petty broker, and take what you need without paying a thing!

column1: The Druchii is fast and jumps out of his seat before you can grab him, but your Ice Wolves have an eye for fast prey and quickly clamp his soft throat in one of their jaws. His bodyguards are quickly - painfully - put to the sword. Naturally, the Dark Elf wretch tells all you need to know; Vaul's Anvil is where the Mother of the Flame is due to be reborn. You don't even flinch at the wet crack as the Ice Wolf bites through his spinal cord.
Your reputation with other Dark Elves will surely be damaged by such an aggressive act, but all you care about is the hunt!
column2: true
It is well known that the Underworld Sea is home to vicious monsters who will easily kill and eat your party if disturbed. Better to live to see another day...
A Kraken rises from the depths and attacks your party! After a hard-fought battle you are able to subdue the beast, but start to wonder if this treasure hunting malarkey is really worth the effort!
On a pedestal in the centre of a still lake sits an item of great magical power. Discovering that the lake is shallow, you wade out and collect the object.
A small row boat allows you to search the shallows. As it does so, a gleam of gold catches your eye. You haul the chest to the surface and treasure spills into the boat.
A Kraken rises from the waters and attacks your party! After a lengthy fight you are badly wounded and limp back to the surface. You conclude that there must be easier ways to swell your coffers!
As you delve deeper into the caverns you become helplessly lost, and members of your party begin to panic. Clearly, it will be some time before you see the sun again...
A small row boat allows you to search the shallows. On hearing the distant roar of a Kraken, your retainers all decide to turn tail and head for the entrance. Spineless cretins, all!
The mechanism is actually pretty simple and you easily manage to open the doors. As they slide open a secret panel is revealed, containing Dwarfen riches.

Some rudimentary investigation reveals a small trapdoor, hidden beneath some barrels, in the corner of the room. The passageway beneath leads back to the vault; you emerge from another direction, to the surprise of your retainers.
The runes explain how to open the door using the complicated mechanism. They also reveal how to construct said mechanism and others like it; Dwarfish secrets? Not for long!
Trapped, you resign yourself to a long wait - it is some time before a retainer triggers the same mechanism and releases you.
Tinkering with the mechanism causes the doors to fly open, but the vault collapses around you. You get out before you're buried alive, but it was a very narrow escape.

In the attempt to escape you accidentally set off a second trap. A powder keg explodes, blowing the doors open and injuring you in the process and illustrating why you should always take a retainer with you...
You quickly remember that you have no idea how to read the runes before you, so escape by your own means seems unlikely. Your only option is to sit and wait for rescue.

When Vlad seized control of Sylvania he turned the majority of its destitute nobility, thus ensuring there is always another von Carstein eager to enact his own plans for domination - even at the expense of his so-called siblings.
Defilement of Sigmar
After a long, bloody night of curved daggers, an ambitious Goblin has emerged as a Big Boss. He presents himself, ready to do your bidding.
The Harbinger
Conflict in a nearby region has driven the inhabitants into your territory. This has greatly increased local tensions, but represents a rich source of cheap manpower for their armies.
From Good Stock
The Sword of Khaine has been claimed by another. Doom stalks the world once more, unless you can wrest it from them!
A Disturbance of the Web

Vampire Knights from the Blood Dragon order pass through our lands. Despite our entreatments, they will not fight for us - some foolish notion of honour prevents it. However, they have left us a gift - a blessing of Abhorash on our own cavalry.

The deed is done - the head of the merchant's rival is brought to you, and so you cast it down to the feet of the Druchii. He smiles and reveals the Mother of the Flame will next appear from Vaul's Anvil. He hands over the pinion and ushers you away. Before leaving, you wish the information to be 'certified'; you call over your thralls and they approach the merchant with thirsty smiles on their faces. the Ice Wolves make short work of his bodyguards...
Thaggoraki Incursion
Your escapades on the high seas have lumbered your army with a curse… losing their sanity in a blood-induced frenzy!
During your adventure on the high seas you salvaged heavy armour and an arsenal of weapons.
Your exploits on the high seas has led to the salvage of arcane imbued blades, enhancing your army’s combat skills.
Your encounter on the high seas is not one the crew or troops will readily talk about, yet they have gained regenerative abilities since the event…
Your exploration of the high seas has led to blessings from the Lord of the Deeps – your troops will be protected from harm while they have the Elven God’s favour.

One may fear the unknown, but as the true shape of a thing is ascertained - as its strengths and weaknesses are appraised - fear gives way to an understanding of its limitations. Through a recent educational program, your troops are coming to understand their enemies better and thus fear them less. As a result, leadership when fighting Skaven and Dark Elves has now increased factionwide.
The Savage Blow
The power of Khaine is yours to wield - you are in possession of the Sword of Khaine!
Treasures of Lustria
Treasures of Lustria

Necromancers are power-mad, often driven insane by the magicks they dabble in. Occasionally, they forget their place and think to usurp the true masters of Undeath - the Vampires. This Necromancer thinks he is better than us…
The Holy Order of the Silver Hammer - accursed Witch Hunters - have been sighted in our lands. Be wary of these silver-wielding mortals, for they are Volkmar's puppets!
Vengeance of the Asrai

A rich vein of uncommonly dense obsinite has been unearthed at the edges of the Copper Desert. Properly worked, it produces a razor-sharp blade with incredible handling that can turn aside lesser weapons with ease. The Skink artisans have set to work forging it into new weapons for distribution among the armed forces. As a result, melee defence capabilities have risen factionwide.
Sadly, it would appear that Old Ones were not at your back on this occasion - better luck next time!
Your herds came across a chapel of the mewling man-scum hammer king and smeared it with filth and the bones of its own priests. Such blasphemy stokes the fear in those who follow such a feeble deity.
Family Strife
Displaced by the Chaos hordes in the north, the Trolls are migrating towards the Badlands, perhaps sensing a dominating presence they can serve?

The powerful Engineers' Guild has sent one of their top tinkerers to inspect this Hold's workshops after hearing concerning rumours of "innovation". On his arrival he is so impressed with the work done he decides to stay.
Black Powder Store Explodes
As Chaos corruption recedes from Avelorn's lands Alarielle begins to grow stronger; emboldened once more she can now return to her former strength.

As Chaos corruption sweeps over the lands of Averlorn like an inevitable wave, Alarielle begins to grow weaker. Surely now she must begin to look elsewhere for help, perhaps only nature itself can help her make one last stand?
Exquisite Goods
This place has known the touch of the gods - and maybe not the patrons of your own race! it would be wise to leave, at once!
You retrieve the sword and make a hasty escape - who knows what tricks and traps may have been left for even the wariest treasure hunter?
A golden tribute to the gods sees the purple glow dissipate; gradually, the ancient sword dulls. On closer inspection it is a fine weapon worthy of a fine warrior!
These passages were not dug for nought; a thorough search unearths treasures beyond counting! Your retainers gather it swiftly, yet carefully, in case of traps.
The second you touch the blade a cloud of purple smoke engulfs you. You stumble and bump into the walls - clearly, your mind is no longer your own...
A rumbling begins, gradually getting louder. Otherworldly, maniacal laughter emanates from... somewhere close. This place is cursed! Only fools would venture further!
A Glimpse into the Realm of Souls
Churches and chapels across the realm are reporting healthy numbers of worshippers. Those close to the Enchantress say that she is pleased; if so, then surely the Lady herself is also?

A new decree has been passed, venerating the ever-vigilant Temple Guard. Performing displays of their peerless halberd mastery in the central plazas of the temple-cities, they swell with pride for their calling and your people are energised like never before. Temple Guard recruitment costs have fallen and public order has risen factionwide as a result.

The clan's Warlock Engineers have found an ingenious use for their ailing slaves… bones are ground into a rich cement, making for an endless supply of mortar. Due to this most excellent development, building costs have decreased factionwide.

Countess Emmanuelle von Liebewitz is a shrewd political player. She has made it known that, while not personal, she does not support your cause. Nuln and Wissenland will remain hostile to you for the foreseeable future.

A sharp-tongued troubadour is touring your lands, reminding his audiences of how Bel Shanaar succeeded Aenarion to become the second Phoenix Lord, denying the Witch King his birthright. Your subjects' hatred is whetted anew, their fury toward the Asur reawakened in earnest. Factionwide, your warriors now have improved leadership and melee attack when fighting against the High Elves.
Packs of Dire Wolves run rampant to blight the lands of the mortals. But a master must bring his dogs to heel at some point - do that and they will be part of our legions, and a more effective tool.
Fresh Corpses
Overconfidence
Under Threat!
Slaver Raids

A new form of directed explosive have been devised specifically for weakening walls. Your sappers have been trained to burrow deep beneath the foundations before placing the bombs for best effect. Few survive the perilous process but no matter, for these new weapons are proving highly effective - factionwide enemy siege holdout time has been reduced as a result.

The Fay Enchantress allows herself a brief, fleeting moment of relief - two of the three rituals are accomplished, and the two most difficult rituals at that. The third is simple - a great final evocation, along with the placement of the Chalice, at the Grand Chapel of Couronne. With its completion, all three locations are in synchronicity, and the ritual begins in earnest.

column1: Before long, the change becomes apparent. The Winds of Magic shift and grow, becoming powerful enough to be observed. Howling just beyond hearing, they cannot be heard, but can be perceived. The Chalice of Potions glows with a brighter aura, and all those who see it know its power. The Fay Enchantress wonders if this will be enough...
column2: true
Grandfather Nurgle has taken an interest in our exploits - he has been generous with his blessings.

Your friendly offer of trade breaks the ice. The dissenters agree to trade weapons for supplies. Unfortunately, their offerings are inferior, but a deal is a deal; at least the rebels are deprived of arms!
Ha! Clearly these rabble-rousers thought themselves safe to speak freely of their treachery. The barn burns to the ground and no one escapes; only the smell of charred flesh remains.
Entering the barn, you challenge the survivors and a stand-off ensues. Enraged by your arrogance, they refuse to surrender. Rallying together, they defame you as a tyrant.
Da Great Green Prophet
There's no reason to engage with desperate people; oft-times, such schemes come to naught anyway. You decide to leave them to their seditious talk and walk away quietly.
Surprised by and failing to recognise you, they listen and agree to trade some of their excellent-looking weapons for supplies. The equipment turns out to be of superior quality.
Providence has brought you here to silence these agitators afore they can act! Their screams fill the air as the barn burns to the ground. Your people feel much safer in their beds.
You take the rebels completely by surprise. Overwhelmed, they surrender and turn over their weapons in return for their miserable lives. Naturally, you have them killed anyway.
An Age of Discovery
The Cursed Sword
The Cursed Sword
The Cursed Sword
The Cursed Sword
The Cursed Sword
The Cursed Sword
The Guilds - fractious and intransigent institutions - have, for once, aligned with each other and are in full support of your rule. Trade will surely prosper!
From the plains, a wandering, lone Greenskin emerges. He's a Shaman, expelled from his previous tribe due to an unfortunate incident "wiv da boss' pet Squig". He's looking for a new master to serve.

As your forces pass through lands barren of life, they see a rare sight: a mighty herd of War Mammoths, migrating across the icy wastes. They are not easy prey, but your men are ruthless and skilled hunters. Soon the air is thick with panicked trumpeting and heavy with the sweet scent of blood. Then, after the slaughter: the feast. Fresh meat brings new strength to your warhird!
Curse of Morr

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him the use of a spell for a short time. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...
Puzzle Failed!
The Graf who holds sway over this region is offended that the Emperor did not invite him to the grand feast of Sigmarzeit. Diplomacy with them will be a little rocky for a while.
Witch Hunter Incursion

The trouble with Goblins is they are sneaky, stabby gits. If you don't keep them in their place they'll get ideas. Now we have a few gobbos trying to take control. The Bosses will put them in their place, but not before they cause mischief.
Seal the Hold
Snotlings Underfoot
Mystery Meat
The noblemen continually have innovative and expansive ideas for how to improve and grow our cities; their wondrous minds give birth to a revolution in construction!
Arctic Might
The Wight Kings of old will fight for us providing the proper forms are followed. We know the rituals so let us send our agents to the barrows and call a Wight King forth.
Know Thy Enemy

A churlish peasant had the snivelling gall to throw a noble from his horse, in retaliation for an apparent 'slight' against his family. He has, naturally, been hanged by the neck until dead, so that nobody else thinks to act rebelliously.

The Wood Elves of the Moonspring Glades, ever interested in unearthing truths about their ancestry, have struck upon a trove of information, buried deep beneath the forest. The scriptures they have uncovered seem to date all the way back to the Great Voyage, when the Elves travelled from Ulthuan and established themselves in Athel Loren. The information contained therein will help shape the future of all Asrai...

A reputed Skink artisan has been dispatched to oversee construction work throughout your provinces. His guidance has highlighted where efficiency is lacking and savings may be made. Building construction costs have now decreased factionwide.
Monster Hunt: Mother of the Flame

Back when Vlad first held Castle Drakenhof - having taken it from the mad count, Otto von Drak - he would hold the most notorious parties. Guests would come in costume with their faces hidden behind bejewelled masks. Music and dancing earlier in the evening would give way to darker and carnal pursuits later on.

column1: Vlad hosts another masqued ball, the first for centuries, where Vampires and willing mortal nobles will receive a smidgen of power in return for their eternal servitude. It is a deal that can only favour the first von Carstein...

Your silver-tongued traders are outdoing themselves; they could sell a beard to a Dawi and make it seem a luxury! Now, the holds of your trade-ships are packed to the gunwhales with exotic goods and levies are at an all-time high. As a result of this mercantile excellence, trade income has increased factionwide.
The Squigs have broken out of their pens, causing havoc, eating their handlers and sending the remaining Night Goblins scattering!
Appease your neighbours or keep hostile ones at bay, for now at least. This will keep our borders stable and allow us to strike at enemies further afield.
Wurrzag, the prancing Shaman of Gork and Mork, visits to bring you good news and the blessing of the Green Godz.
Acting quickly your retainers are able to take the eggs from the nest and get away safely. However, you are unable to sell them as no one believes they are real!
Turning from the eggs you begin your search of the nest. At that point, the Dragon returns and attacks! You manage to escape relatively unscathed, but there is a huge rend in your armour.
Leaving the nest safely behind, you search the surrounding area but to no avail. It's time to give up on the day - maybe tomorrow will be more fruitful?
The Black Dragon could return at any moment. If it does it's reasonable to presume that you're whole party is dead. Therefore, it would be wise to not disturb the nest.
Acting quickly, your retainers are able to take the eggs from the nest and get away safely. The trade in Dragon eggs is booming; you will make an excellent profit.
Dragon eggs are hard to sell and dangerous to transport. Instead you search through the bones in the base of the nest and find something shining in the debris.
Leaving the nest you decide to search the surrounding area. Below the Dragon's nest lies a horde of treasure that must have fallen from above during a hasty, airborne escape!

Bretonnian crusaders have returned home bearing the remains of King Amanhotep at the head of their army, foolishly believing him to be one of their own nobles. Upon his awakening, the Tomb King slaughtered entire towns before returning to his rest. We should capitalise on the disorder and use this opportunity to strike!
A Brutal Business

Those Waywatchers that become attuned to the forest's every motion soon find they prefer the company of the trees to their own kindred. These 'Waystalkers' are the most expert of hunters, singularly dedicated to the whims of Athel Loren…

Striding through the twisted network of beast-paths, the herds happen across an immense and ancient herdstone. Carved with mysterious runes, the stone records many forbidden and lost ways of Cloven Ones.

All the world is a stage and Cylostra had given her ultimate performance. Her prize, the Merwyrm of the High Elves, Amanar. Good! They stole her life, so she took from them Lothern’s guardian. Yet now their precious Vortex quivers, Ulthuan shall sink and she will sing to the Phoenix King as he chokes on seawater!

column1: Bathing in the adoration of her mindless, groaning crew, she was temporarily oblivious when a visitor appeared upon the deck of the Lamprey. It was a thing of rags, incorporeal and long-dead.
Enchantress, it whispered in greeting with an unearthly hiss. Cylostra flexed her flabellum to hide her face.
Who addresses Madame-Captain Direfin? she asked in her most self-important voice.

I come at the behest of my master, said the ghostly emissary. "He asks if you desire a return to Bretonnia? Where he has been working against the living for some time and could use a spirit of such prodigious talent."
The Madame-Captain inspected her silvery form in the mirror as she considered a response.
A patron, she mused. "And who is it that shows such interest in moi?"
Like you, mistress, he is an Enchanter, and a great one no less. He has gone under many names over the centuries. At this time, he is only known as 'The Nameless'.

Although they tried to hide it, the peasants of a nearby village were discovered with traces of a new, foul pox. To keep it from spreading, the entire village was swiftly burned to cinders; the potential crisis has been averted.
Tomes of Power
You don't manage to find anything of interest. It seems the strangers got here first and cleaned the place out. You curse the skies and leave.
Your gut feeling was correct! You join up with the scavengers to search the ruins. However, after a few hours they disappear, along with some of your belongings!
You manage to chase off the scavengers with ease. It's unfortunate, but not a total surprise to find that they hadn't located anything of value either.
The other party are not known to you, and they are carrying a variety of very sharp-looking weapons with them. Plunder is never worth losing your life over; you leave empty handed.
You find a few discarded trinkets that may have some worth, but have the sinking feeling that the main hoard has been lost to the strangers. You win some, you lose some.

Unusually, the scavengers welcome your offer and you join them in their search. Whilst working alongside the strangers you manage to find a hidden vault of treasure. Now, if only there was a way to avoid splitting the profits with them...?
At the first sign of trouble the scavengers flee, leaving all their belongings. Some beings are just not cut for high-energy, high-stakes work such as this!
A Fortuitous Mistake
The expedition was a success, and the dam was breached. Parts of Stirland are flooded!
Dung Pile Explosion
Pain Makers

The wind was in her favour and now she had a new pet! Captain Saltspite unleashed a rare laugh as the Swordfysh effortlessly glided through the waves. She was more than a mere pirate now, but a governess of many ports and richer than most Tilean princes. Maybe she should have shunned the living long ago?

column1: It’s true that at first she had abhorred the Vampires and their zombie thralls on her ship, and only tolerated it due to the Seafather’s commandment. Yet, as they had slowly replaced the living and brought her victory after victory, Saltspite grew less concerned. Now she struggled to remember when she had last spoken to someone with breath and not seawater in their lungs.

Who needs friends when you have power? That is what her uncle had told her anyway… for, of late, Manann spoke to her less and less. But there was another who filled that void; this one spoke of storms and sharks, and glorified her as the ultimate predator. He would take care of his niece and together they would rule the waves.
column2: true

The rival salvagers you spotted turned out to be a freebooting horde of Undead pirates. As you approached the putrid remains, they turned their guns and cannons on you. After dispatching them in the ensuing sea battle, you looted their galleon’s coffers which had recently been filled with trinkets and valuables extracted from the dead beast’s belly.

Such vast wealth does not go missing out on the open ocean without pirates catching wind of it, and before long a galleon helmed by a particularly belligerent Vampire Admiral appeared in a cloud of broadside guns and hissing black powder weapons, blocking your passage. After defeating the Undead freebooter, you looted their galleon’s coffers before sailing on to claim the salvage from the convoy for yourself.

Before you can set foot upon the island, you are set upon by a Vampire Admiral who had arrived there just before you and was bolstering his forces with the reanimated corpses of the dead crewmen rotting on the beaches. After defeating the Undead freebooters, you looted the Vampire’s moored galleon before claiming all the salvage on the island for yourself.

The pirate cove contained great wealth in the form of treasures and items stolen from across the four corners, but getting to it was no easy feat. When the Vampire Admiral at the helm of the black ship saw you approach, he immediately readied his horde of crewmen and darkling creatures for battle. After defeating the Undead freebooters, you ransacked their ship as well as the hidden cave to make for a plentiful hoard!

Before you could reach the sea monster’s corpse you were suddenly accosted by a horde of Undead pirates also staking a claim to the potentially valuable remains. After dispatching them in the ensuing sea battle, you looted their galleon’s coffers before sailing on to the beast’s remains, where your crew were able to cut open its belly and extract further wealth and treasures.

While sailing towards the wreckage of the ship from Marienburg, a galleon helmed by a hissing Vampire Admiral appeared in a cloud of broadside guns and cracking black powder weapons, blocking your passage. After defeating the Undead freebooter, you looted their galleon’s coffers before sailing on to claim the salvage from the Marienburg wreck for yourself.

Compelled by the eerie songs carried on the sea breeze, you ordered your crew to disembark onto the mysterious islet. Before you could start searching for treasures, however, you are set upon by some Vampire pirates who seemed to have appeared out of nowhere. The songs of the cursed Syreens were obviously a trap! After defeating the Undead freebooters controlling them, you looted the Vampire’s moored galleon before claiming all the salvage on the island for yourself.

A corpse of such a size does not go unnoticed by the brigands of the sea, and sure enough on your way to the monster’s remains you are accosted by a Vampire Admiral’s fleet. After dispatching them in the ensuing sea battle, you looted their galleon before sailing on to the leviathan's remains, where your crew were able to cut open its belly and extract further wealth and treasures.

As you approached the wreckage, a galleon of Undead pirates appeared in a cloud of broadside guns and hissing black powder weapons, seeking to claim the sunken ship’s treasure for themselves. After defeating the Undead freebooters, you looted their galleon’s coffers before sailing on to claim the salvage from the sunken ship for yourself.

Before you can set foot upon the island, you are set upon by a Vampire Admiral who had arrived there just before you and was bolstering his forces with the reanimated corpses of the shipwrecked dead rotting amongst the rocks. After defeating the Undead freebooters, you looted the Vampire’s moored galleon before claiming all the salvage on the island for yourself.

Phakth is pleased with his tribute. As the knife strikes home and the Norscan exhales his last, a glow suffuses Settra's troop, and a bright beam pierces the firmament, highlighting a point of land far-distant. A Liche Priest produces a map and marks the destination.

The Liche Priests bend to their work. As the Norscan is swiftly denuded, he babbles the source of his wealth: Ice Tooth Mountain. His outsize skeleton is soon back on its feet, an impressive specimen indeed. Settra commands it to lead the way to his crown's resting-place.
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!
The luring grin of Morrslieb is visible; it dominates the night sky and those who look up at it are said to go insane or driven to murderous rage. Order must be restored.
Godly Wrath

A bitter disagreement has come about between Ostland and Hochland over who invented the famous long rifle! Ages-old resentments have come to the surface, and, due to our alliance with Ostland, Hochland remain highly suspicious of our intentions.

For years, the mental instabilities caused by his multiple personalities have prevented him from wielding the Winds of Magic, but no more – the Lore of the Deep eludes him no longer!

It would seem that many of the local inhabitants are uncomfortable livin' under laws decreed an' enforced by Unlivin' masters. This matter is pressing, as many of these malcontents - these 'malfeasants' - now feel they can air such sedition publicly.

Morr, the God of Death, is a sworn enemy of Nagash and all Undead for we tamper with His so-called holy rules. Where his priests roam they bless the lands and make it harder for our ilk to raise the dead.

Stood upon the deck of the Bloody Reaver, Count Noctilus looked out across the sea. If he were still living, he may have taken a deep breath, but those days of heartbeats and warm blood were long gone. Nevertheless, still cursed with a mortal’s desires, Noctilus could not hide his pleasure. Amanar was his; a gargantuan corpse enthused with Necromantic energy to wield against his foes.

column1: He would continue to expand his network of coves and burgeoning empire outwards from the Galleon’s Graveyard, for there was still much power to be sought. Let the other fools battle for the Vortex, he would feed the skull-strewn Maelstrom with soul-power, and when it was ready, he would sail the Bloody Reaver into it. Then the Count could ply the seas of time, go anywhere or any-when; it was the ancestors of Jaego Roth who had the most to fear, for he would hunt them all down. History itself will not be safe from Nyklaus von Carstein!

The Rik has sealed the Dwarfhold - the great bar lays across its mountain doors and in the deeps the iron gates have come crashing down, severing the Underway. Why the Lord would do this is as yet a mystery!
Sneaky Gobbos
The brayherds gather around the herdstone in an orgy of bloody greed - feasting on captives and the weaker runts of the herd. The Gors will be sated and healthy for some time.

This local noble has always held a deep dislike of Karl Franz, ever since they courted the same girl a few years back. Needless to say, the Prince of Altdorf won the maiden's heart, further hardening the rival's hatred.

The winds blow ever fierce and cold in the North, but on this day the gale's bite is unusually strong.  Such harshness serves only to strengthen the resolve of your warriors, and as their wills harden so do their very hides - their skin becomes as tough as stone. Honour this gift and the Gods who have bestowed it. Spill blood in their names!
The Carstein Ring

Your Hero proves himself to be very capable, successfully returning and dumping the hog-tied Bretonnian herb collector at your feet, scared but alive. The Goblins were about to make stew out of him, but your Hero was able to cause a distraction and rescue him, snatching the naked prisoner right out of the large man-sized cauldron they had placed him in to be boiled alive. Your opportunistic servant also managed to grab some of the Goblins’ loot on his way out, making the mission more than worthwhile.
Beastmen Raids
There are many Necromancers hiding within mortal society. We must bring them under our thrall, so they may further our aims. Call to them, and see which broken souls answer!
A terrible nexus of vortices sets down and ravages through the tribes - the Gods are angry!

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him some temporary effects. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...

There’s nothing clever or subtle here, simply our agent disguising themselves though mundane and arcane means into a factor of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}} and giving a large gift of precious things to {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetFactionName}}.

Let the races believe the notion that we dwindle but that our reach is still vast, our power to adjudicate and even dictate trade relations remains unchallenged. Granting {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}} and {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetFactionName}} favourable trade relations will strengthen relations between them, for our gain.

A wagon full of high-quality blades and armour has been delivered to {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}}. It is mere child’s play to insinuate that this gift is from {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetFactionName}} – they will be too stupid and flattered to deny it!
Ratbush

While the younger races frolic and fight we take advantage for our gains. Let us advise {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}} to make overtures to {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetName}} of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetFactionName}}. If they think it is their own idea, then more’s the better!
